Text:
YouTube’s curbing of anti-vaccine content is a strong first step.

But this doesn't mark the end of our fight against deadly misinformation.

These policies must be enforced.

And we must keep pushing for other companies to follow suit.

What do you say, @Amazon and @Facebook?

Let’s not overcomplicate this:

Republicans passed a $2 trillion tax cut for billionaires and corporations.

And now they’re refusing to pay for it.

It’s really that simple.

Crack & cocaine are chemically identical.

The only difference? How we punish their use.

80% of those in federal prison on drug charges are Black or Hispanic.

This disparity is the stark reality of the racial biases plaguing our justice system.

It's past time to root them out.

A government shutdown and default means:

Millions of jobs lost
Families pushed into poverty
Our economy in a downturn

A catastrophe. 

But Mitch McConnell, Kevin McCarthy, and Republicans have a different term for it:

A win - at least in their craven brand of politics.

Dreamers are Americans. And proudly so.
 
This is their home. It will always be.
 
Protecting DACA is a moral imperative.
 
And this is just the beginning of our efforts to create a pathway to citizenship for those seeking refuge, safety, and stability.

https://t.co/Z43An4lFwk

Republicans across the nation are working tirelessly to rob women of their right to choose.
 
These bans on abortion are draconian – and just plain wrong.
 
We cannot let them stand.
 
That's why I just voted YES on the Women’s Health Protection Act.

The #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act isn’t about one man, one party, or even one moment in time.
 
It’s about ensuring that our democracy endures — no matter who’s in the White House.
 
And we should all be able to get behind that.

https://t.co/yFbFZ9auxT
Tallulah appreciates your support for her policy priorities. https://t.co/Xfl9OtHo9P https://t.co/PPHcVPGY8D

We must do everything in our power to bring the horrific conflict in Yemen to an end.
 
And we must start by cutting off funding to the coalition fueling this devastating war.
 
We cannot be a party to such suffering. https://t.co/PQcA5N5x31

For four years, our democracy was tested by a man with no moral compass.

But Trump’s most dangerous act was leaving a roadmap for a future executive to abuse the power of the presidency.

Congress must respond — and we are — with the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act. https://t.co/0ulLO78sn5

Try not to punch down, but Jim Jordan’s obsession with me borders on unhealthy.

Want evidence? How about providing internal polling to Kremlin intelligence while they ran a social media campaign for Trump?

Or is that business as usual for the GOP? 

https://t.co/vua2e1mLsu https://t.co/bwPXLjrLBn

There is no higher priority than protecting our people. None.

As we examine the cause of the illness known as Havana Syndrome, we must ensure those impacted get the care they deserve.
 
My HAVANA Act will do just that. And it's on its way to President Biden's desk for signature.

I want to thank @SpeakerPelosi, @RepJerryNadler, @RepMaloney, @RepJohnYarmuth, @RepZoeLofgren, @RepGregoryMeeks, @RepRichardNeal, and so many of my other colleagues for ensuring that protecting democracy is a priority for this Congress and our country.

6/6

Our democracy is in critical danger. 

And so, we must act. With fierce urgency.

Because if we don’t, we stand to lose everything.

And I fear we won’t be able to get it back.
 
5/6

That’s why I JUST introduced the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act.

A landmark package of reforms that will root out corruption, rein in presidential abuses of power, and strengthen our system of checks and balances.

It's big, bold, and badly needed.
 
4/6

Fortunately, the former president no longer holds that office. 
But the weaknesses he exploited remain.

And we cannot wait for the next demagogue or wannabe authoritarian to come along before we take decisive action.

We must act. Now. Before it's too late.

3/6

Trump was not the architect of the systemic failures that weakened our country and tore at our national fabric. 

He simply exposed and exploited vulnerabilities that have lingered for decades.

And proved just how ruinous these cracks in our democratic foundation can be.

2/6

It’s no secret Donald Trump held little regard for our country, our Constitution, or our democracy.

He only cared about himself.

He trampled on our norms and institutions, violating laws and breaking long-standing precedent with shocking ease.

🧵 Here’s how we fix it: 
 
1/6 https://t.co/8Ve46JCTba

We will be judged by how we treat our most vulnerable. 
 
Refugees are at great risk, and come in search of a better life, inspired by the promise of the American dream.

Reports of their mistreatment are a stain on our legacy.

Those responsible must be held to account. https://t.co/rEkhGin25J

Democracy is the defining ideal of our nation. Our lifeblood.
 
But right now, that sacred legacy is in grave danger.
 
So, we must take aggressive action to defend it.
 
We must pass the #ProtectingOurDemocracyAct.

It seems impossible that we’ve been without our lioness of law for a year.
 
Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg led a truly remarkable life.
 
She was a trail-blazer in every sense of the word.
 
And though she may be gone, her legacy continues to inspire millions –  including me. https://t.co/yH2gfncnQ9

I'm horrified that a U.S. strike killed 10 Afghan civilians, most of them children.
 
We must conduct thorough oversight into this matter and press for answers and accountability.
 
I will continue to pray for the victims and their families.
 
My full statement: https://t.co/eXJPGhdlbb

From my family to yours, may all those who observe have an easy fast and a meaningful Yom Kippur.
 
We’ve been through so much in the past year, and I hope you find peace during this moment of reflection.
 
G'mar Chatima Tovah.

Despite the financial strain caused by COVID-19, the overall poverty rate in the U.S. fell in 2020.

How is that possible?

Two words: direct relief.

Putting money into the pockets of struggling Americans builds a more equitable economy.

Now let’s make these efforts permanent. https://t.co/dw26aNp0EE

As Trump spread lies about the 2020 election, one GOP official asked: “What’s the downside for humoring him?”

Well, there’s insurrection. 

And this. This is the downside.

Even now, Republicans continue to parrot these baseless conspiracies.

Further undermining our democracy. https://t.co/GQCA5e00nw

Two decades later, the memory of September 11, 2001 is as painful as ever and the loss is just as acute.
 
Our hearts are with the loved ones of all those we lost on that tragic day.
 
We will never forget their stories, their legacies, or their courage.

We must spare no effort to restore the right to choose in Texas.
 
Because let’s be clear: banning abortion doesn’t actually end abortion. 
 
Just safe ones.
 
We can never return to the days of back alleys and coat hangers.
 
Never.

Vaccine hesitancy stands between us and the end of this pandemic.
 
And companies like @amazon and @facebook must do far more to tackle the viral spread of misinformation online.
 
We need transparency. And we need accountability.
 
Lives are on the line.
 
Read my letters. ⤵ https://t.co/yo0iBcTw2p

Trump just said the California recall is “probably rigged.” It's not.
 
And even this week, Elder said “we know there were shenanigans” in 2020. There weren't.
 
It’s the same darn cynical playbook.
 
Spread misinformation. Confuse the voters. Subvert our democracy. Repeat.

Rosh Hashanah is a time for hope.

A celebration of the sweet things in life and the sweeter things still to come.

And for me, there’s nothing sweeter than spending time with family.

L'shanah tovah!

The labor movement helped build a better America.

By fighting for paid time off, health benefits, and so much more.

So as you enjoy this long weekend, take time to thank those who work to keep our country running and the unions who’ve got their backs.

Here are the facts: 

1. People of color tend to live closer to polluters and hazardous waste sites.

2. Those communities often don’t have the infrastructure for extreme weather.

3. The climate crisis is here. But its impact is not equal.

Climate justice is racial justice.

This is what we feared.

When Republicans stole a Supreme Court seat from the American people, they did it for exactly this purpose:

To erase a woman’s right to choose.

And early this morning, at 12:01AM, Texas did just that.

This cannot stand.

Republicans are scared. Absolutely terrified.

They know that most people don’t support them or their backward policies.

So they’re trying like hell to suppress the vote.

And blocking our efforts in Congress to stop them.

There’s no accommodating them. They must be defeated.

With just one round of child tax credit payments, the child poverty rate was slashed by 25%.

You read that right: 25%.

And it reminds us of a simple fact: we have the power to end childhood poverty.

All we need is the will to act.

Our fallen servicemembers have returned home.

Their bravery helped evacuate over 100,000 people and saved countless lives.

They were the best of us. And we will not forget them. 

May God give comfort to their families. https://t.co/GvEUQbN2rp

California has always been a shining beacon of hope for refugees and immigrants in need of safe harbor.

And today that obligation is perhaps more sacred than ever before.

That's why we sent a letter to @POTUS to let it be known:

Afghan refugees are welcome here. https://t.co/Apc8TnIx8M

Devastating to learn of the loss of U.S. servicemembers and Afghans at Kabul Airport.

While it is too early to draw any conclusions, ISIS-K had a clear motivation to disrupt our efforts.

My prayers are with our brave servicemembers as they continue these vital evacuations. https://t.co/iliCK2Y0u1

My office is helping constituents get loved ones out of Afghanistan, along with interpreters, journalists, women leaders, activists, and others at great risk. 
 
And we’ll continue to do this vital work.

No effort must be spared to evacuate all Americans and our Afghan allies: https://t.co/mN1pPp81hA

Just an unfriendly reminder:

Every single House Republican voted against protecting the right to vote.

Every. Single. Republican.

Don’t let them forget it.

The House has passed a budget to invest in:

🌎 Green energy & jobs
🎓 Free community college & early childhood education
🇺🇸 A pathway to citizenship
👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Paid family & medical leave

And more.

It’s time to invest in our communities to build an economy that works for everyone.

The right to vote is under attack. Our democracy is in unprecedented peril.

History will remember us by how we meet this moment.

Are we willing to stand up for democracy?

I am.

Let’s pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. Before it's too late.

The FDA has officially granted full approval to the Pfizer vaccine, confirming what experts already knew:
 
These vaccines are SAFE. And these vaccines WORK.

If you haven’t already, please go get your shot TODAY.

It’s FREE. It’s EASY. And you very well may SAVE A LIFE.

YOURS.

Erasing student loan debt for people with disabilities is a win in the fight for a more just society.

It ensures that the doors of higher education stay open to all—no matter their ability to pay.

This is just the beginning of our work to erase the burden of student loan debt. https://t.co/fr2vDqtsWf

As we evacuate Americans and Afghan allies, we must help journalists who risked their lives in pursuit of the truth.

Today, @RepSteveChabot and I delivered a letter to @POTUS calling on the administration to offer safe passage to the press.

We must ensure no one is left behind. https://t.co/RlyxjxfqSQ

I believe every American has the right to vote. Period.
 
Republicans vehemently disagree. 
 
They’d prefer to pick their voters, rather than letting the voters pick them.
 
They’re waging war on democracy. That must end.
 
It’s time to pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act. Now.

FireGuard helps firefighters react to wildfires before they spiral out of control.

And when lives and livelihoods are on the line, every second counts.

If we don’t act, this program will expire — we can’t let that happen.

Read our letter to @DeptofDefense. ⤵️ https://t.co/KMxdCnVtrn

The scenes unfolding in Afghanistan are heartbreaking. 

As we evacuate U.S. personnel, we have an obligation to our Afghan partners, allies and women in serious danger.

My statement: https://t.co/U8r3QdRcrt

No child should ever go hungry. Full stop.
 
The Child Tax Credits – now hitting the bank accounts of millions – will help end childhood hunger.
 
We must make these middle class tax cuts permanent. Failing to do so amounts to nothing more than failing the most vulnerable kids. https://t.co/8KW1ymrkh6

The Senate just passed a bipartisan infrastructure bill.

That’s a big deal. But the next step must be an investment in our people, too.

We need to address climate, health care, housing, education and childcare.

Investing in our people, our country and our planet.

Let’s do it.

Too many impacts from climate change are now “irreversible,” says a new UN report.

But that doesn’t mean we give up. Far from it. It means we act.

Right now to ensure action on climate is part of any infrastructure investment.

Right now to include it in any budget.

Right now.

Our democracy faces its greatest threat in generations.

Republicans across the country are working to suppress the vote, particularly for Black, Hispanic, and Indigenous Americans.

It’s Jim Crow 2.0. It’s despicable and dangerous, and it cannot stand.

We must restore the vote.

For 10 years, my student loans were more than my rent.

And it’s gotten so much worse.

Pausing student loan payments will help thousands of students.

But we must do more to ease the burden — and cancel up to $50,000 in student debt — before it crushes a whole new generation.

We must close the Guantanamo Bay detention facility.

It can be done safely and it’s continued operation is inconsistent with our commitment to the rule of law.

That’s why I joined 72 colleagues to call on @POTUS to fulfill his promise and close its doors.

Read our letter. ⤵️ https://t.co/5YIeV8BhcB

Richard Trumka dedicated his life to elevating working Americans.

He was an exceptional leader — and an even better person.

My heart breaks for his family and for the country, which just lost one of the foremost champions for the rights of working families. https://t.co/XBiHOHspYV

This eviction moratorium will keep millions of people in their homes.

And it wouldn’t be possible without leadership from @RepMaxineWaters, @RepCori, and so many others.

Now, we must seek permanent solutions to help our unhoused neighbors.

Because we can, and must, do better. https://t.co/XryAovqczt

.@RepCori knows the stakes. And she’s not backing down.

Neither should we.

Millions of Americans are in imminent danger of being evicted from their homes.

We cannot sit idly by. 

We must extend the eviction moratorium. https://t.co/Fh6wnjC02o

On January 6, Officer Gunther Hashida fought valiantly to defend our nation’s Capitol from a violent mob of domestic terrorists.

He risked his life in service of his country.

May his memory be a blessing — for his family and for this country.

Michael Freedy will never marry his fiancé or watch his kids grow up.
 
His life was cut needlessly short by COVID-19.
 
One of his final texts: ‘I should have gotten the damn vaccine.'
 
Please, go get the damn vaccine. https://t.co/f3wGBWPjVW

Making light of striking the Speaker after a mob broke into the Capitol intent on doing her violence?

Real funny @GOPLeader

Questioning the life-saving science on wearing a mask? 

Real smart @GOPLeader

The GOP under Trump and McCarthy is a dangerous cult.

And that’s no joke.

Housing is a fundamental right. Everyone deserves a roof over their head.
 
If we don’t act, more than 3 million Americans could face eviction.
 
And forcing people out of their homes during a global pandemic is exceptionally cruel.
 
Congress must step in before it’s too late.
There’s still more to learn about what happened on January 6. https://t.co/7vfzHe6Fhc

Officer Dunn asked, is this America?

Is it? Resorting to violence when we lose an election? 

So driven by hate that we attack those who look or vote different?

If so, God help us.

I believe in America. These officers are why. They are the future. 

Not those who attacked us. https://t.co/CQexrNP020

I was on the floor as the Capitol was under siege.

I was evacuated by police, along with my House colleagues, staff, and members of the press.

Those courageous individuals saved lives — mine may have been one of them.

They're heroes. And their stories deserve to be told. https://t.co/9sAhYREgp0

Speaker Pelosi’s decision to appoint @RepKinzinger to the Jan. 6 Select Committee is the right one.

This investigation is a moral and constitutional imperative that should transcend partisan politics.

Congressman Kinzinger knows that — and I look forward to working with him. https://t.co/R6dHhslezj

The Delta variant doesn’t care if you're a Democrat or Republican.
 
It’s infectious. It’s deadly. And it’s on the rise.
 
If you are unvaccinated, you are at risk.
 
I strongly encourage everyone to get vaccinated.
 
Find out more: https://t.co/GsoUsR0xnk

The Republican Party is a shell of its former self.

What we see today is a cult of personality beholden to the whims of a disgraced, former president.

Republicans of good conscience — both in power and out — must take their party back.

America needs two functional parties.

Speaking truth to power takes courage. Especially when it subjects you to vile, racist hate.

Officer Dunn is a patriot who risked his life to protect the Capitol and our democracy, and continues to fight for the truth.

That’s far more than anyone can say about @TuckerCarlson.

Our most sacred value – the right to vote – is on the line.

@RepHankJohnson and activists know the stakes. And they're willing to risk their own freedom to preserve ours.

We cannot let that sacrifice be in vain.

We must end the filibuster. We must protect our democracy. https://t.co/eTCiJJJds0

As we withdraw from Afghanistan, we must do right by our Afghan partners who served alongside us.

Today, we took action, led by @RepJasonCrow, to expand the visa program and ensure our Afghan partners can be evacuated to safety.

Their lives depend on us keeping our promises.

McCarthy is scared. Stefanik, too. They never wanted an investigation into Jan. 6 to go forward because they are afraid of what America will learn.

Now they’re throwing pointless partisan bombs hoping no one realizes they’ve once again put Trump before country.

Investigating January 6 is a sober endeavor. One demanding good faith participation from both parties. 

Time after time, McCarthy has shown he is not up to that task. 

But we cannot allow him to derail our important work or appoint others who will. 
We will uncover the truth.

Listen, I’m all for space exploration and it must have been an amazing view.

But maybe – and I’m just spitballing here – if Amazon and other companies paid their fair share in taxes, we could lift all kids — if not into space — at least out of poverty.

Sincerely,

Earthlings

After four years of unfettered corruption, justice is finally catching up to the former president's criminal associates.

Thomas Barrack may be the latest Trump aide held responsible for his crimes —

But he certainly won't be the last. https://t.co/uyGeAXYoCi

Just 12 people are responsible for the majority of anti-vaccine disinformation on social media.

And 99% of all COVID deaths are among unvaccinated individuals.
 
Social media companies can—and must— stop the deadly spread of misinformation.

These lies cost lives.

A year ago, we lost one of our greatest leaders in Congress, an American hero, and a dear friend.

While we feel his absence, his spirit will never leave us.

It inspires us to keep making good trouble. And fighting to protect the vote.

We miss you, John. https://t.co/wJ9kfvqft9

The American dream belongs to all of us, including those brought here as children.

This terrible and heartbreaking ruling only reaffirms what we’ve long known: These protections need the force of law.

Congress must create a pathway to citizenship for Dreamers. https://t.co/oLtfpn2Hc2

If our citizens can’t vote, how can our democracy thrive? 

If people don’t have health care, a living wage, or clean air and water, how can they thrive?

Democracy isn't just a system of government. It's a promise.

And it's up to all of us — each generation — to fulfill it.

Nine voting rights activists arrested for peacefully demonstrating.

For standing up for our democracy.

We've seen this before. And we know how it ends: democracy WILL prevail.

Proud to stand in solidarity with @RepBeatty and all those fighting for our democracy. https://t.co/PJn01xlIKO

Every Republican in Congress voted against expanding the Child Tax Credit.

Every. Single. One.

But despite their opposition, those checks are hitting American families' bank accounts today.

And they're projected to cut child poverty in HALF.

I don’t know about you, but I’m pro-vaccines and anti-COVID, anti-flu, anti-HPV ... well, really anti-diseases killing people.

How on earth is that partisan opinion now? https://t.co/L2uFkBG3qh

The stakes are high. Voting rights, health care, climate change, and so much more — they’re all on the line.

The people who voted and organized and marched expect action. The country demands it. 

The path is clear. We must end the filibuster.

There is simply no other way.

BIG NEWS: On July 15, the first Child Tax Credit payments will go out.
 
For millions of families, that means:
✔️ More food on the table.
✔️ Less financial anxiety.
✔️ Better long-term outcomes.
 
We can cut child poverty in half. Learn more at https://t.co/JlZbiVt8TG.

Cubans are suffering devastating food, medicine, and power shortages — made worse by the pandemic and an authoritarian regime enriching itself rather than supporting its people.

We stand with peaceful Cubans in their continued struggle for freedom, dignity, and a better life.

Heatwaves like this aren’t a matter of inconvenience: they’re a matter of life-and-death.

So we must act like lives are at stake.

We must fight for a #GreenNewDeal. https://t.co/t4mqaowEBU

Gun violence never takes a holiday.

500 shootings. 618 injuries. 233 deaths. 1 weekend.

It’s time for Republicans in Congress to stop pretending and see the gun violence epidemic for what it is:

A national emergency.

https://t.co/bZ6LlQEWfX

Six months ago, a violent mob stormed the Capitol trying to undermine our democracy. Lives were lost and countless more endangered.

And Republicans are desperate as ever to keep the truth of that dark day hidden.

Enough.

It’s time to follow the facts, wherever they lead.

After a year of so much hardship and sacrifice, what a joy it is to be able to celebrate freedom, liberty, and the promise of America safely together again with friends, neighbors, and loved ones.
 
Happy 4th of July to you and yours! https://t.co/FRQ1w1stFG

Trump’s business and chief financial officer indicted.

Can anyone be surprised?

Trump also used his charitable foundation as a personal and political slush fund.

His corruption didn’t start in the Oval Office.

He just brought it with him.

A con man from start to finish. https://t.co/Jk4bw3c0Rq

On January 6, our democracy survived its greatest threat since the Civil War.

We’ve yet to learn the truth of that sad day.

But we will have a full accounting.

I’m humbled to serve on the January 6 Select Committee. It's time to get to work.

In McCarthy’s GOP, you’re still in good standing if you:

Fundraise with white nationalists.
Promote dangerous conspiracy theories.

But if you dare participate in an investigation into a deadly insurrection? You’re finished.

A cult of lies, with loyalty to Trump over all else.

We gave the GOP every chance to work on a bipartisan commission to investigate January 6.

They said no. Over and over and over again.

So is anyone really surprised that Republicans are – yet again – trying to bury the truth about the insurrection?

Enough. We have work to do.

The heat plaguing our country is deadly serious. Record-breaking temperatures are causing heatstroke and power outages, melting cables, and buckling roadways. And worse is still to come.
 
The climate crisis is here, and we see the consequences.
 
We need a Green New Deal. Now.

Republicans know they can’t win with their backward policies.
 
So they’re trying to decide future elections by passing laws making it harder for people of color to vote.
 
These laws are daggers pointed at the heart of our democracy.
 
And they must be stopped. https://t.co/EJNsistTd7

Did you know that more than 20 states have zero protections for LGBTQ+ individuals?

Shawn Balentine is the first openly gay Hollywood stuntman, and when he travels for work, his rights are at risk.

We sat down to discuss why it's time to pass the Equality Act: https://t.co/KCG8Uqfshl

Bill Barr is not the first to try to rehabilitate his reputation after carrying Trump’s dirty water.

And he won’t be the last.

But no amount of spin can mitigate the damage he did by misleading the public and destroying DOJ’s independence.

He will carry that stain forever. https://t.co/TIhHMiOKbM

In her Shelby v. Holder dissent, Justice Ginsburg likened gutting the Voting Rights Act to closing an umbrella in a storm because you're not getting wet.

We've been without that umbrella for 8 years now.

And our democracy has been drowning ever since.

We must restore the vote.

The news out of Miami is horrifying.
 
My heart breaks for the families and friends of the individuals who died, and for the families of all those who remain unaccounted for.
 
I’ll be praying for their safety and for the entire Surfside community as they heal from this tragedy.

Extending an eviction moratorium gives families time to recover from COVID.

But time alone won't solve the affordable housing crisis.

Unless we invest in housing infrastructure, this extension only lengthens the gangplank. We must stop millions from being pushed off the edge. https://t.co/H3d3hsRiZX

Senate Republicans just voted to block:

-Protecting and expanding voting rights
-Rooting out corruption
-Reigning in dark money and special interests

The GOP voted against our democracy today.

But with or without them, we must protect our democracy for generations to come.
